item.title: Weeds / thorny bushes taking over pavement. Unable to continue easily with wheelchair or pushchair., 3rd November
item.description:
On the pavement either side of Farriers Reach heading towards Stoke Orchard on the right hand side, the weeds and bushes are so overgrown that I was not able to continue walking with my Mum who is in a wheelchair without pushing her on the grass verge, close to the traffic on a very busy road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Residue from Collected Previous Fly tip, 3rd November
item.description:
The location is the entrance to the Old quarry off Cleeve Common Road. The fly tip reported at that location recently was collected promptly - thank you. HOWEVER, the small particles of Foam Rubber from the tip materials was left behind as was a plastic mirror. The former if ingested by farm animals is potentially dangerous while the latter if smashed could leave very sharp splinters which would not be good for dog's feet or vehicle tyres. It also invites further tipping. Please can this be cleared up as soon as possible - both in front of and behind the wall?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reports that surface of alleyway is waterlogged and/or very muddy for most of the time - causing a hazard, 3rd November
item.description:
The alleyway is between Cordingley Close and Station Rd Churchdown, and is used heaviliy by families going to and from the infant and junior schools. I have had 5 reports in the last 2 weeks that the surface is either totally waterlogged or really mussy. This is causing children to have wet feet all when they arrive at school, or kids slipping in the mud and falling over. It also proving very difficult for people to push prams, buggies or wheelchairs in the alleyway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole, 3rd November
item.description:
Not visible and difficult/ dangerous to avoid. Ruined tyre and now waiting for RAC

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109, Old Bath Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 3rd November
item.description:
Gen enq fwd by Customer services 02.11.23 - Details of your enquiry: Hi Customer service team, ive received a bill for replacement tyres (both front tyres) on car, i drive on the road between Broadway and Winchcombe B4632 on daily basis to get to work in Bishops Cleeve from my home, unfortunately the tyres and tracking on my car required replacing due to the large amount of pot holes and quality of the road, please can you advise where i can send the invoice to claim for this damage to my motor vehicle, the tyres were only replaced in April 2023 and now in October 2023 they've been replaced again, Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

pothole which damaged/ burst tire, customer will call back to make a claim

item.title: Outside 34 Bedford Avenue, 2nd November
item.description:
Highways come out to fix a problem with the kerbs but this absolutely shocking work has been done. The kerbs haven’t been put back properly and a section of the tarmac has been cut out on the area that I paid a lot of money to get put in. It’s a disgrace and need redoing asap before any water gets under the rest of the tarmac that I have had put in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Bedford Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Light is permanently out, 2nd November
item.description:
The street light is out next to the garages off back lane. This light is used to light the rear of residents houses and parking and is in constant use. It’s not safe at night to not have it well lit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Forgotten “FLOOD” road signs not collected, 2nd November
item.description:
2 FLOOD signs which have been in situ for the last 2 weeks still not collected & now older children are messing around them them. They are also now blocking the pavements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farrant Avenue, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 2nd November
item.description:
